channel.title: Finance
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Finance, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Every year, a billionaire CEO doles out $1,000 checks to local college grads—with a catch: They have to give half the money to charity
item.description: “The turmoil in our country has increased the need for caring, sharing and compassion,” Rob Hale said.

item.title: ‘Adapt, shrink or die’: Trump begins slashing UN aid with $2 billion pledge a fraction of previous contributions
item.description: The money reflects what the administration believes is generous and will maintain the United States’ status as the world’s largest humanitarian donor.

item.title: MassMutual Moving At ‘Warp Speed’ On AI Efforts
item.description: Modern systems and clear productivity gains are giving the 174-year-old insurer the confidence to move quickly toward AI agents in software developmen...

item.title: The weakest labor market since 2011 has BofA asking, ‘Dude, where’s my job?’
item.description: "A lack of recovery in the jobs market and a slower U.S. economy are key risks to watch for 2026."

item.title: African millennials and Gen Z are quitting their big-city dreams to go make more money back on the farm
item.description: “A lot of my friends who graduated at the same time as me now work as motorcycle taxi drivers and barely make a living,” says 33-year-old Filly Mangas...

item.title: How Agent Swarms Will Change The Web And Everything Else
item.description: AI agents will reshape 2026: they’ll feed on synthetic/structured data, remake the web, swarm unpredictably, and empower prosumers.

item.title: Quordle Hints And Answers For Tuesday, December 30
item.description: Looking for some help with today’s Quordle words? Some hints and the answers are right here to give you a hand.

item.title: New York City finally joins London, Singapore and other world-class cities with a tap-only subway system
item.description: The Metrocard replaced the subway token in 1994, but now it's being phased out for tap-and-go, first introduced in 2019.

item.title: US economy expected to grow faster in 2026 despite stagnant job market: Goldman Sachs
item.description: Goldman Sachs economists predict U.S. economic growth will accelerate to 2.6% in 2026, driven by tax cuts, reduced tariff drag and Federal Reserve rat...

item.title: A ‘Release The Stranger Things Season 5 Cut’ Conspiracy Movement Has Begun
item.description: There's a new conspiracy that Stranger Things has hours of cut footage that will solve all its current problems, but it just isn't real.

item.title: Vince Gilligan Responds To The Hate For Pluribus’ Slow Pace
item.description: Many criticize the slow pace of Pluribus across its nine episodes on Apple TV, but now creator Vince Gilligan is responding to those critics.

item.title: These stocks have fallen hard in 2025. Analysts are gauging their 2026 upsides.
Economic calendar: Week kicks off with pending-home-sales and home-price reports
Warren Buffett hands off Berkshire’s reins this week. He leaves 5 parting gifts.
This silver-tracking ETF is having its worst trading session since 2020
Ten ideas that could really help solve America’s affordability crisis in 2026
IRS reveals updated retirement contribution limits for 2026
item.description: New retirement plan contribution limits announced by the IRS for 2026 include higher 401(k), IRA and catch-up contribution amounts for enhanced retire...

item.title: Jack in the Box shut down more than 70 stores with more expected by year's end over financial struggles
item.description: Jack in the Box is closing dozens of restaurants as part of a major cost-cutting plan, with 72 locations shuttered so far and more expected in the nea...

item.title: $400k shipment of live lobsters hijacked en route to Midwest Costco locations
item.description: The FBI is investigating the theft of a $400,000 lobster delivery bound for Costco locations in Illinois and Minnesota that was allegedly hijacked.

item.title: Holiday barks sold at Aldi recalled over potential undeclared pecans, wheat: FDA
item.description: Silvestri Sweets recalled Choceur-branded holiday bark sold at Aldi stores after a packaging mix-up led to undeclared allergens in the popular treats.

item.title: What to Know About China's DeepSeek AI
item.description: The Chinese upstart says it has trained high-performing AI models cheaply, without using the most advanced chips.

item.title: Tech, Media & Telecom Roundup: Market Talk
item.description: DeepSeek, SoFi and more in the latest Market Talks covering Technology, Media and Telecom.

item.title: Reid Hoffman Raises $24.6 Million for AI Cancer-Research Startup
item.description: The LinkedIn co-founder is starting Manas AI with “The Emperor of All Maladies” author Siddhartha Mukherjee.

item.title: Silicon Valley Is Raving About a Made-in-China AI Model
item.description: DeepSeek is called “amazing and impressive” despite working with less-advanced chips.

item.title: Can an App Replace a Personal Trainer? I Tested Nearly a Dozen to Find Out
item.description: Apps can add flexibility and freshness to your routine. Just try not to get injured.
